actions.committee: Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry.

official_title: A bill to further amend the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Makes it illegal to falsely represent that an agricultural product in interstate commerce has been officially inspected or graded as being of a particular class, grade, quality, size, quantity or condition. States that the use by any person of the letters "US" or "USDA", or any class, grade, quality, size, quantity, or condition terms specified in official United States standards effective under the Agricultural Marketing Act in connection with any representation as to inspection, or class, grade, quality, size, quantity, or condition of agricultural product shall constitute a representation that the product has been officially inspected and passed or graded. Makes such representation, if false, subject to penalty.

titles.title: A bill to further amend the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946.
